tit.cmt: へいほうか、ひょうほうか双方の読みで書かれているので2つとも記載しました。

sen.j: 兵法家とは、以下を意味する。
sen.e: 兵法家 (reads heihoka/hyohoka);
sen.cmt: Wikipediaページ上では、「兵法家とは、」の下に１． ２．というリストされる形で書かれていたので、「；」を使いました。また読みの違い、意味の違いを示しているので、漢字を残しました。
sen.e: 兵法家 (reads heihoka/hyohoka);
兵法家 (reads heihoka/hyohoka) refers to the following.
sen.cmt: 「兵法家とは、」に「以下を意味する」を補足しました。

sen.j: 「へいほうか」とは、中国の孫武や呉起など軍学としての戦略、戦術を説く兵法者。
sen.e: Heihoka' is a tactician such as Sun Wu and Wu Qi who preached on strategy of military science.
Heihoka' is a tactician such as Sun Wu and Wu Qi who preached on tactics and strategy of military science.
Heihoka' is a tactician such as Sun Wu and Wu Qi who preached on tactics and strategy of military science.

sen.j: 「ひょうほうか」とは、日本の戦国時代 (日本)の日本武術家。
sen.e: Hyohoka' is a Japanese martial artist in the Japanese Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: 「～日本の戦国時代 (日本)の日本武術家。」の（日本）がwebの方には無く、文章的にも必要ないので訳していません。
sen.e: Hyohoka' is a Japanese martial artist in the Japanese Sengoku period (period of warring states).
Hyohoka' is a Japanese martial artist in the Japanese Sengoku period (period of warring states).
Details are explained below.
Details are explained below.
Details are explained below.

sen.j: 兵法家（ひょうほうか）は、日本の戦国時代 (日本)に、武芸（剣術・槍術などの日本武術）を教授することにより生計を立てていた者のこと。
sen.e: Hyohoka is one who made living by teaching military art (especially Japanese martial art such as kenjutsu and the art of the spearmanship) in Japanese Sengoku period.
Hyohoka is one who made a living by teaching military art (especially Japanese martial art such as kenjutsu (swordplay) and the art of the spearmanship) in Japanese Sengoku period.
Hyohoka is one who made a living by teaching military art (especially Japanese martial art such as kenjutsu (swordplay) and the art of the spearmanship) in Japanese Sengoku period.

sen.j: 「兵法（ひょうほう）」はあくまで個人の武芸の技を磨くものである。
sen.e: Purpose of art of warfare (兵法: reads hyoho) is to develop individual military art techniques.
Purpose of art of warfare (兵法: reads hyoho) is to develop individual military art techniques.
Purpose of art of warfare (兵法: reads hyoho) is to develop individual military art techniques.

sen.j: そのため、実戦においてはあまり役に立つものとは考えられておらず、高名な武将（加藤清正・福島正則など）であっても兵法を習ったというものは少ない。
sen.e: Therefore it was not considered practical and many of famous busho (Japanese military commander), such as Kiyomasa KATO and Masanori FUKUSHIMA, did not learn art of warfare.
sen.cmt: few…learntまたnot many…learnt という表現にすると、「加藤清正・福島正則」が習った、というような表現とも取れてしまうので、「多くの高名な武将＝加藤清正・福島正則などが習わなかった」という表現にしました。一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Therefore it was not considered practical in actual warfare, and even among famous busho (Japanese military commander) such as Kiyomasa KATO and Masanori FUKUSHIMA, few of them learned art of warfare.
sen.cmt: in actual warfare、even amongを追加しました。Did not learn → few of them leaned
sen.e: Therefore it was not considered practical in actual warfare, and even among famous busho (Japanese military commander) such as Kiyomasa KATO and Masanori FUKUSHIMA, few of them learned art of warfare.

sen.j: むしろ当時は足軽技とみなされる傾向にあった。
sen.e: It was rather considered as an ashigaru waza (art of common foot soldier).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was rather considered as an ashigaru waza (art of common foot soldier).
It was rather considered as an ashigaru waza (art of common foot soldier).

sen.j: 兵法家として自称したのは、塚原卜伝・上泉信綱・宮本武蔵などが有名である。
sen.e: Famous people who professed as hyohoka were Bokuden TSUKAHARA, Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI and Musashi MIYAMOTO etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Famous people who called himself hyohoka included Bokuden TSUKAHARA, Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI and Musashi MIYAMOTO.
Famous people who called himself hyohoka included Bokuden TSUKAHARA, Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI and Musashi MIYAMOTO.

sen.j: ただし、兵法家の価値は全般的には必ずしも高くはなかった。
sen.e: However hyohoka was not generally valued high.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However hyohoka was not generally valued high.
However hyohoka was not generally valued high.

sen.j: （大局を宰領する武将とはみなされなかったのであろう。）
sen.e: (It is believed that they were not considered as busho who managed the main issue.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (It is believed that they were not considered as busho who managed the main issue.)
(It is believed that they were not considered as busho who managed the main issue.)

sen.j: 大名出身の柳生藩以外でもっとも高禄であった宮本武蔵でさえ、晩年、細川氏において、客分700石という小藩の家老程度の待遇であった。
sen.e: Even Musashi MIYAMOTO, who earned highest salary apart from daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in Yagyu Domain, was only 700 koku (194.6 cubic meters) at Hosokawa clan in his later years, which is an equal treatment of a chief retainer in a shohan (domain where crop yields are small).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Even Musashi MIYAMOTO, who earned highest salary apart from daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in Yagyu Domain, was only 700 koku (194.6 cubic meters) at Hosokawa clan in his later years, which is an equal treatment of a chief retainer in a shohan (domain where crop yields are small).

Even Musashi MIYAMOTO, who earned highest salary apart from daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in Yagyu Domain, was only 700 koku (194.6 cubic meters) at Hosokawa clan in his later years, which is an equal treatment of a chief retainer in a shohan (domain where crop yields are small).

sen.j: （もっとも武蔵はその芸術家的天分と剣術を形而上的領域にまで昇華したという点で、並みの「兵法家」とは区別できる）。
sen.e: (However Musashi can be distinguished from normal 'Hyohoka' considering his artistic talent and the fact that he sublimated kenjutsu to metaphysical level.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (However Musashi can be distinguished from normal 'Hyohoka' considering his artistic talent and the fact that he sublimated kenjutsu to metaphysical level.)
(However Musashi can be distinguished from normal 'Hyohoka' considering his artistic talent and the fact that he sublimated kenjutsu to metaphysical level.)
